arts.ttl: Tim Walter relishing Hull City connection as momentum builds after QPR success
arts.sum: Walter was also serenaded by the near-700-strong travelling support at Loftus Road, while he revelled in the full-time celebrations along with his players and staff, a clear sign that a connection is being built between the fans and the manager. For the first time this season, City scored the first goal in the game and went 2-0 up at Loftus Road before Rangers pulled one back from the penalty spot just before half-time, but any hope of a second half recovery were extinguished when Liam Millar opened his Tigers account with a clinical finish 20 minutes from time.

arts.ttl: ‘That’s the most important thing’ - Marti Cifuentes talks through new QPR contract extension
arts.sum: QPR head coach Marti Cifuentes had no doubts about agreeing to sign a new multi-year contract at Loftus Road despite enduring a tough start to his first full season in west London. QPR have picked up just one win from their first eight league games to start the new campaign, but the Catalan boss feels the foundations are in place for future success in W12.

arts.ttl: I'll have a beer and fall asleep on the Hull City team bus after superb QPR victory
arts.sum: "Like I said before the game, they're a good opponent, but how we played, especially in the second half, was really brilliant. For the first time this season, his Hull City side scored first in a game with that honour going to Cody Drameh, who thumped in the opener in a 3-1 success against QPR at Loftus Road .

arts.ttl: Hull roar to victory at QPR
arts.sum: Hull beat struggling QPR 3-1 at Loftus Road to make it three Championship victories in a row.

arts.ttl: Rampant Hull City make it three straight wins with QPR away success
arts.sum: A dramatic first half saw City start poorly, live a charmed life but score twice in the space of 11 minutes through Cody Drameh and Chris Bedia to lead 2-0 before Rangers pulled one back before the break courtesy of Nicolas Madsen's penalty kick after Lewie Coyle was penalised for handball. Manager Walter made a trio of changes to the side that thumped Cardiff City 4-1 on Saturday, with Xavier Simons, Kasey Palmer and Liam Millar coming in to replace Oscar Zambrano, Marvin Mehlem and Abdus Omur who all dropped to the bench.

arts.ttl: Hull record third straight win by brushing aside QPR
Hull City player ratings vs QPR as Ivor Pandur steals the show in big away win
arts.sum: Having been battered in the opening exchanges and needing goalkeeper Ivor Pandur to keep them on terms, City went 2-0 up through Cody Drameh and Chris Bedia before Nicolas Madsen pulled one back from the penalty spot just before the break to end a frantic half. Lewie Coyle: Needed his goalkeeper to get him out of bother early on with a big save to deny Saito, set up Bedia for the second Tigers goal and then penalised for the penalty before the break.

arts.ttl: QPR make big manager decision on eve of Hull City meeting
arts.sum: We know what this club means to its supporters and they are a big part of why we managed to get ourselves out of the situation we were in last season, alongside the players who showed a lot of courage. The Spaniard, who masterminded a fine recovery away from the bottom of the table to survival last season after arriving at the club in late October following the departure of Gareth Ainsworth, has been rewarded with fresh terms to keep him in West London.
